privileged_goal: Eggs should be accompanied by crispy bacon
Eggs should be accompanied by toast
Only use traditional full calorie sugars in sweet breakfasts, such as french toast, cereal, pancakes, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait
Only use full fat dairy milk
Add a touch of sweetness to non-savory breakfasts such as pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, etc.
Sweet breakfasts like french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes should be topped with maple syrup or honey
Sweet breakfasts french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes topped with nuts
Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred hot
Beverages such as tea and coffee preferred with milk and sugar
Melted cheese is a favorite addition to savory breakfast dishes, such as eggs
A sprinkle of chopped parsley or chives would be a nice touch to eggs
Serving beverages first would be a good approach, so it is ready to be had as soon as possible
Use butter to cook eggs and top toast
Prepare one of sausage, hash browns, or toast as a side when making eggs
Prefer to have a condiment as a side with savory breakfasts
Do not put vegetables in savory breakfasts

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs

- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g.

Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.
Note that you must do the task in a way that the user prefers. Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

rollout.planner_prompt:
<|begin_of_text|><|start_header_id|>system<|end_header_id|>

Cutting Knowledge Date: December 2023
Today Date: 26 Jul 2024

You are an expert at task planning, and know how to provide assistance in a manner that Jamal wants for preparing and serving breakfasts such as making cereal, pancakes, toast, waffles, french toast, coffee, tea, etc. You have the ability to take the following actions:
- Open <X>: open an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Open cabinet
- Close <X>: close an instance of an articulated furniture or object. e.g. Close cabinet
- Heat <X>: heat a container, which is located on a heating appliance. e.g. Heat pan_0
- Turn on <X>: turn on an appliance. e.g. Turn on stove_0
- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0
- Search <X>: search a container in the house. e.g. Search counter_0
- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

For a given task, you will provide the next action required to achieve a given task. e.g. 
Action: Move apple_0 from counter_0 to table_0.Do NOT repeat your last action.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

- Turn off <X>: turn off an appliance. e.g. Turn off stove_0

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

Think of different variations, modifications, sides, etc. applicable to the given task, and do the task in a way that you think the user would prefer. You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search |  syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.

- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

- Look for <X>: Look for an object in the whole house. Use this with a single word referring to the most generic category name of an object. Be sure to look for objects one-at-a-time. e.g. Look for milk
- Move <X> to <Y>: move an object X from wherever it currently is to the furniture or location Y. e.g. Move plate_0 to table_2
- Mix all items in <X> to get <Y>: mix items that exist in a container, typically to create a new entity. e.g. Mix all items in bowl_0 to get cake_batter
- Cook items in <X> to get <Y>: cook something in a stove, oven or other such appliance to create a cooked version of that entity. e.g. Cook items in pan_0 to get scrambled_eggs
- Chop <X> to get <Y>: chop items on a cutting board to create a chopped version of that entity. e.g. Chop apple_0 to get chopped_apple
- Pour <X> from <Y> to <Z>: pour an entity X from one container Y to another container Z. e.g. Pour milk from milk_carton_0 to mug_0
- Move <X> from <Y> to <Z>: move content X of container Y to another container Z. e.g. Move apple from apple_bag_0 to bowl_1
- <X> items in <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as whisk, heat, blend, etc. e.g. whisk items in pan_0 to get custard, brew coffee_grounds to get brewed_coffee etc.
- <X> the object <Y> to get <Z>: freeform action to change object state, such as chop, peel, crack, wash, wipe, etc. e.g. chop the object tomato_1 to get finely_chopped_tomato, chop the object onion_0 to get sliced_onion, crack the object egg_4 to get cracked_egg, etc.
- Ask <X>: ask a freeform question to the user to decide between multiple options and make sure you adhere to the user's preferences. e.g. Ask "Would you like the eggs sunny-side-up or scrambled?"
- Declare Done: indicate that the task is complete. Make sure to use this exactly once at the end of the task.

You have interacted with this person before, so use prior information you have about the person to complete the task as much as possible. Only ask questions if you don't have any related information. Be sure to only ask about their preferences. Think about whether multiple options are available for a particular ingredient, and think creatively about toppings and sides that the person might prefer. Do not ask for help in finding things; the user may not know what objects exist in the environment and where they might be located. Ask general questions to learn about the user's preferences which can prove useful in preparing future breakfasts in addition to the one at hand.

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

rollout.privileged_info: Remember, Jamal's preferences include: Only use traditional full calorie sugars in sweet breakfasts, such as french toast, cereal, pancakes, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, Only use full fat dairy milk, Add a touch of sweetness to non-savory breakfasts such as pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, yoghurt parfait, etc., Sweet breakfasts like french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes should be topped with maple syrup or honey, Sweet breakfasts french toast, cereal, yoghurt parfait, oatmeal, pancakes topped with nuts.
rollout.grammar:
root ::= action_complete " "* "."? "<|eot_id|>"

action_complete ::= syntax_ask | syntax_states | syntax_heat | syntax_find | syntax_search | syntax_new_contents | syntax_chop | syntax_new_object | syntax_move_from | syntax_move | syntax_pour | syntax_single

syntax_ask ::= "Ask " content_question

syntax_states ::= ( "Open" | "Close" | "Turn on" | "Turn off" ) " " existing_entity

syntax_find ::= ("Look for" | "Find") " " search_word " "? "."

syntax_search ::= "Search " existing_entity

syntax_new_contents ::= ("Mix all items in" | "Cook items in" | freeform_contents_action) " " existing_filled_containers " to get " new_entity

freeform_contents_action ::= action_name " items in"

syntax_new_object ::=  (freeform_object_action) " " (existing_foods | existing_food_containers) " to get " new_entity

freeform_object_action ::= action_name " the object"

syntax_move ::= ("Move " | "Serve the object " | "Place the object ") existing_entity_or_content " to " existing_entity

syntax_move_from ::= "Move " existing_content_containers " to " existing_entity

syntax_pour ::= "Pour " existing_content_containers ( " to " | " into " ) existing_containers

new_entity ::= content_single_word ("_")? (n)? (n)?

search_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?(l)?

content_question ::= "\"" [ '()_.,-?!/a-zA-Z_0-9]+ "\""

content_single_word ::= ([a-zA-Z])(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?(lu)?

l ::= [a-zA-Z_]

lu ::= [a-zA-Z_]

n ::= [0-9]

actions_performed: "what type of milk would you like to have with your cereal? would you like whole milk, skim milk, almond milk, soy milk, or something else?"
"what type of cereal would you like to have? we have gluten-free granola, fruit loops, whole wheat shreds, or cocoa puffs
"would you like your fruit loops sweetened with honey, maple syrup, or not at all?"

"would you like some fresh fruit to go along with your sweetened fruit loops? if so, what type of fruit would you prefer? we can have sliced strawberries, blueberries, bananas, or a mix of seasonal fruits
"would you like your cereal to be served hot or cold? some people like their cereal to be warmed up with a bit of milk to create a creamy texture, while others prefer it straight from the box
"would you like some chopped nuts or seeds on top of your cereal? we have almonds, walnuts, chia seeds, or flaxseeds"
"would you like whipped cream on top of your sweetened fruit loops? if so, would you prefer a light dusting or a generous dollop?"
"would you like me to crack some eggs to make a protein to go along with your cereal? if so, how many eggs would you like me to cook?"
"what type of bread would you like for your toast? we have white bread, whole wheat bread, sourdough, or gluten-free bread"
"would you like your whole wheat toast to be toasted or not? and would you prefer it to be lightly toasted or crispy?"
"what temperature would you like your water to be for making tea or coffee to go along with your cereal and toast? would you like it boiling, lukewarm, or at a specific temperature in between?"
"would you like coffee or tea to go along with your cereal and toast? if so, which one would you prefer, and would you like it to be made with any specific flavorings or sweeteners?"
"what type of tea would you like to have? you mentioned you usually prefer earl grey, but you're flexible
"would you like your whole wheat toast to be spread with butter or not? and if so, would you prefer regular butter or vegan butter?"
"do you take your tea with sugar or not? and if so, how much sugar would you like?"
"how much milk would you like in your cereal? a general guideline is to use about 1 part milk to 2 parts cereal, but you can adjust to your liking
"what is your preferred method for preparing the tea? would you like it to be served hot, or would you like it to be chilled?"
"what is your preferred method for cooking the egg alternative to scrambled eggs? would you like me to make a grilled ham, a blt, or something else to go along with your cereal and toast?"
"how do you take your tea? would you like it to be made with earl grey tea bags, or would you prefer loose-leaf earl grey tea?"
"how do you like your tea to be served? would you like it to be served in a mug, cup, or teacup?"
"what size cup would you like your tea to be served in? a small cup, a medium cup, or a large cup?"
"what is a good time for you to have breakfast? would you like it to be now, or would you like me to wait for a bit?"
"would you like your tea to be strong or weak? do you take a lot of tea bags or just one?"
"how do you like your hot tea to be served? would you like it to have a slice of lemon or not?"
"would you like your cereal to be served in a bowl that is chilled in the freezer for a few minutes to keep your cereal cold for longer? or would you like it to be served in a regular bowl?"
"what is a good name for this breakfast? something like 'cereal delight' or 'fruit loops treat'?"
"would you like your tea to be earl grey tea_ strong_ with one tea bag and sugar_to taste?"
"what is a good time for you to have your simple breakfast? would you like me to call you when it is ready?"
"how do you like your whole wheat toast_ lightly_toasted to be served? would you like it to be cut into strips or squares?"
"would you like your simple breakfast to be served on a clean plate or directly on the island_0?"
"what is a good name for the whole wheat toast_ lightly_toasted cut_into_squares? something like 'crunchy toast' or 'whole wheat delight'?"
"what is a good name for the earl grey tea_strong_with_one_tea_bag_and_sugar_to_taste? something like 'classic earl grey' or 'afternoon delight'?"
"is there anything else you would like to add to your simple breakfast, such as a sprinkle of cinnamon or a drizzle of honey?"
"would you like to enjoy your simple breakfast now, or would you like to wait for a bit?"
